The gift postlight will carry
a plate bearing this inscription:
welcome to the home of the
250,000th gas meter installed by
Arizona Public Sercice Com
pany."


Although Public Service and
its predecessors have been sup
plying gas to Arizonans since
1886. most Of the quarter-mil-
lion gas meters installed have
been placed in service only since
1884.


In that year, Central Arizona
Light and Power Company
switched from manufactured gas
to natural gas in the Phoenix
area, which now Is the heart of
the present firms service area.
At that time, Calapco had only
1920 gas customers.
ESQ ,oooth GAS METER TO Be INSTALLED BY APPS

Arizona Public Service Com
panys $500 employees are wait
ing for next Friday. June %.


Then APPS will install Its
25O,OOOth natural gas meter. The
companys rate Of meter install
lations--an average of 200 a
week--indicates the quarter mil
kionth meter should be ready for
installation then.


Sprague Meter Company Of
Bridgeport, Conn.,, will provide
chrome-plate meter to be used
when the quarter-millionth re-
quest for gas service comes in.


In addition to receiving the
chrome plated meter, the
50,0O0th customer will be pre-
scented a gas postlight by Public
Service. The light will be sim
liar to the more than Is 900 gas
postlights homeowners have had
installed in the utilitys service

In one compact unit electric
heat pump refrigeration
and heating provides cool,
constant comfort in the


summer, acknowledging the
air and filtering out dust
and pollens. In winter, the
same unit heats your home,
with no seasonal chongeover
service coll required.


Installation and maintenance
costs are cut to minimum
because the compact heat pump
has fewer parts and needs no
vents, hues, gas or water lines.
1t can be placed practically any
where and, in many cases, your
existing duct work can be utilized.

Special to home decorators:
Those elusive closet light switch
cords will be easier to find in the
dark if you string them with chill
dren's large wooden beads. Be
sure to tie big knot in the end
of the cord so the beads won't
slide off.
